question.text: Which among the following statements is false ?

options.text: The correct order of osmotic pressure for <math> <mrow> <mn>0.01</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>M</mtext></mrow> </math> aqueous solution of each compound is <math> <mrow> <mtext>B</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub> <mtext>l</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo>></mo><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>C</mtext><msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>Sucrose</mtext></mrow> </math>.

The osmotic pressure<math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mtext>π</mtext></mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math>   of a solution is given by the equation <math> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mtext>π</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>Μ</mtext> <mtext></mtext><mtext>R</mtext><mo>⁡</mo> <mtext></mtext><mtext>T</mtext><mo>⁡</mo> <mtext>,</mtext>  </mrow> </math>where M is the molarity of the solution).
Raoult's law states that the vapour pressure of a component over a solution is proportional to it's mole fraction.
Two sucrose solutions of the same molality prepared in different solvents will have the same freezing point depression.

solution.text:
(i) Osmotic pressure π=i  CRT

∴ concentration is same so π∝i (number of ions)

i for BaC l 2 =3, KCl=2, C H 3 COOH   ≤ 1< i≤2 and for sucrose =1

So, order of osmotic pressure BaC l 2 >KCl>C H 3 COOH>Sucrose
Acetic acid does not dissociate completely. Hence, its van't Hoff factor will be in between 1 and 2.

(ii) The extent of depression in freezing point varies with the number of solute particles for a fixed solvent only and it's a characteristic feature of the nature of solvent also Δ T⁡ f⁡ = k f⁡ × m⁡ 
For different solvents,value of k f is also different so, for two different solvents the extent of depression may vary even if same number of solute particles be dissolved in them.
